nav.div: Arlington Public Schools » Administration » Health Services » Coronavirus (COVID-19)

br.strong: Updated student meal distribution form for April 27-May 1

br.br:
The meal distribution form for April 27-May 1 has been updated and is available here:
Meal Distribution Form
Completing the form helps us identify how many meals to prepare for each location.
Meals at Presidents Elementary and Arlington High School can be picked up between 10:30 a.m. and 12:30 p.m. Breakfast and lunch meals can be picked up at the following mobile locations between 9:45 a.m. and 11:45 a.m.
• Lutheran Church in Silvana (1717 Ole Larson Rd)
• Arlington Heights Community Club
• Oso Fire Station
• Bryant Community Grange (across from Bryant Store)
• Angel of the Winds Casino South Parking Lot
• Sisco Heights Church (McElroy Rd)
• Kent Prairie Elementary School
• Mobile Estates (off 67th Ave NE in Arlington)
• High Clover @ 47th Ave and High Clover Blvd
• Trafton General Store
• Rivercrest (207th St NE/61st Ave NE
• 62nd Dr. NE/200th PL NE
• Jordan River Trails
• Heartland Homes (196th Pl. NE/45th Dr. NE)
• Pioneer Elementary School
On Fridays, the Arlington Community Food Bank will be providing weekend meals for all students at all sites as part of their “Meals ‘til Monday” Program.
Community Resources
During this difficult time, we wanted to make sure you are aware of resources that are available to you. Our Teaching and Learning Department has compiled a list of important community resources such as:
• Arlington Community Food Bank
• Arlington Community Resource Center
• Displaced/Homeless Students
• Crisis Connections
• Important Phone Numbers
• Meals
• School Counselors
• Snohomish County Safe Place
• Unemployment
The full list can be found here:
Community Resources
The district also utilizes SafeSchools Alert, a tip reporting service that allows students, staff, families and community members to submit safety concerns to our administration in five different ways:
1. App: Search for “SafeSchools Alert” in the App Store to download for free
2. Phone: 844.241.1346
3. Text: Text your tip to 844.241.1346
4. Email: 1348@alert1.us
5. Web: http://1348.alert1.us
You can report any safety issue you're concerned about through SafeSchools Alert. When you submit a tip, be sure to use our district’s identification code (1348) in your communication.
Every SafeSchools Alert tip received by our district is immediately logged in the system and our administration is notified so that they can investigate and take appropriate action. Tips may also be submitted anonymously if you prefer.
